remarks:
2011-May-24 09:11:22 by bbockelm:
Which schedd's are crashing? The remote one or the local one? Is it only happening when Condor-C is used?

I'm using a PROPER build with the Globus5 in EPEL and haven't observed any crashes on our production schedd's. (But maybe I'm just lucky?)

2011-May-24 10:14:36 by zmiller:
the "client" side is crashing, whether it's a schedd or condor_q.

2011-May-24 10:40:16 by bbockelm:
This should trigger it then, right:

[bbockelm@red ~]$ _CONDOR_SEC_CLIENT_AUTHENTICATION_METHODS=GSI _CONDOR_SEC_CLIENT_AUTHENTICATION=REQUIRED condor_q -debug

If so, I can't reproduce locally... sadly, it means the issue is going to be very subtle and perhaps version-specific.

2011-May-24 10:53:39 by zmiller:
date points: 
  7.6.1 client to 7.6.1 server: server segfaults
  7.6.1 client to 7.6.0 server: client segfaults
  7.6.0 client to 7.6.1 server: server segfaults
  7.6.0 client to 7.6.0 server: no problem
so it seems it doesn't matter if it's client or server, 7.6.1 as compiled and installed at the UW will segfault when using GSI.

2011-May-24 16:48:20 by jfrey:
This is caused by a change in how the externals are built. Now, every external is installed into a separate directory (the same as before the cmake changes happened). With this change, some additional CFLAGS and LDFLAGS need be set when building Globus. As it was, Globus was built referring to the system openssl, but linked with the externals openssl. Any differences in struct layouts or the like will cause memory corruption.

I just pushed a fix.
